Widget.name: Result List
Widget.Description: This widget displays the search results in a list view. Each result (or hit) is displayed in a pane displaying a title and N given metas depending on your data model configuration.
Widget.Preview:
Title


metaA: valueA
metaB: valueB
metaC: valueC

Option.name: Hit title
Option.Description: Specifies the title displayed for each hit. Leave blank to use the Title defined in the source feed.

Option.name: Hit URL
Option.Description: Specifies the link to create for each hit title.

Option.name: Display hit icon
Option.Description: Displays the icons of documents (reflects the document MIME type).

Option.name: Display hit ID
Option.Description: Displays the Hit ID.

Option.name: Display hit content
Option.Description: Displays the Hit content.

Option.name: Truncate hit content
Option.Description: Truncates the hit content if the number of characters exceeds the given value (default is 500).

Option.name: Display hit preview
Option.Description: Enables the link to CloudView's document preview feature.

Option.name: Display hit dowload
Option.Description: Enables the link to CloudView's document download feature.

Option.name: Similar hits URL
Option.Description: Specifies an URL that will display similar hits.

Option.name: Buttons alignment
Option.Description: Specifies how to align the buttons.

Option.name: Display metas
Option.Description: Displays metas in the hit content.

Option.name: Custom meta display
Option.Description: Customizes the meta display with your specifications.

Option.name: Custom HTML
Option.Description: Specifies the HTML to use to display the hit metas.

Option.name: Meta URL Target
Option.Description: Specifies where to open metas with URLs.

Option.name: Display empty metas
Option.Description: Displays the names of metas with no (or empty) values.

Option.name: Meta filtering method
Option.Description: Specifies the filtering method to apply to the metas. For the 'Exclude'and 'Include' methods, the 'Meta list' field allows to specify the metas to include or exclude.

Option.name: Meta list
Option.Description: The specified metas, separated by commas, will be either the only ones displayed ('Include' method) or the only ones hidden ('Exclude' method).

Option.name: Meta sort method
Option.Description: Specifies how metas will be sorted.

Option.name: Display facets
Option.Description: Displays facets in the hit content.

Option.name: Destination page on click
Option.Description: Indicates the URL that must be accessed for a refinement option. If blank, you stay on the same page.

Option.name: Display empty facet
Option.Description: Displays empty facets, that is to say, facets that do not have any categories.

Option.name: Facet list mode
Option.Description:
Specifies the facet list filtering mode.
For the 'Exclude' and 'Include' modes, the 'Facet list' field allows to specify the metas to include or exclude.

Option.name: Facet list
Option.Description: The specified facets, separated by commas, will be either the only ones displayed ('Include' mode) or the only ones hidden ('Exclude' mode). Leaving the facet list empty iterates over all facets.

Option.name: Sort facets by
Option.Description: Sorts the facets using the selected method. Selecting anything but 'default' impacts performance.

Option.name: Sort categories by
Option.Description: Changes the order in which hit categories are returned. Selecting anything but 'default' impacts performance.

Option.name: Display thumbnails
Option.Description: If set to true, a thumbnail will be displayed next to the hit.

Option.name: Use CloudView thumbnails
Option.Description: If set to true, use the fetcher to retrieve CloudView's computed thumbnails.

Option.name: Default URL thumbnail
Option.Description: Specifies the URL of the default thumbnail that will be displayed if there are no thumbnails available in the feed's hit. Leave this field blank to have default, mime-type dependent thumbnails.

Option.name: Hit JSP template
Option.Description:
Specifies the JSP template to use.
Using variables for finding a valid template is useful if you want to customize hit display based for example, on the TYPE.
Hit templates are in /WEB-INF/jsp/widgets/mobileDisplayHits/templates/.

Option.name: Default template (mandatory)
Option.Description:
Defines the default template to use when the Hit JSP template does not exist or is not defined.
For example, when no custom template for the current TYPE has been found.
The hit templates are in the 'templates' base path.

Option.name: Widget Title
Option.Description: Widget title. If blank, no name is displayed.

Option.name: JSP path to use if no results
Option.Description: If there are no results, the widget is either hidden using a trigger, or a message is displayed using the content of a JSP file.

Option.name: Base path of the JSP templates
Option.Description: You can replace the relative path by an absolute path like /WEB-INF/jsp/mydirectory/.
